abstract_summ: We report the case of an asymptomatic (no fever, no cough, no dyspnea) 80-year-old woman who had an (18)F-FDG PET/CT scan for initial staging of Lieberkühnian adenocarcinoma located on anal canal . Chest analysis incidentally revealed bilateral diffuse patchy ground-glass opacity . This was consistent with incidental COVID-19 infection finding during the March 2020 pandemic . The infection was confirmed by reverse transcription–polymerase chain reaction .
